page.title: 04ST. JOHN'S CHURCH, BILTON
page.content: The correct name of Bilton Church is The Parish Church of St. John the Evangelist. It was designed by{Sir {Gilbert Scott}and completed in 1857. Old drawings of the church show a steeple but this was taken down in the early 1970's. The total cost was met by{William Sheepshanks,}his son Thomas was the first vicar. The Sunday school was built in 1897 as was the Vicarage which is now used as a library. The churchyard was quite large and 1600 people have been buried in the graveyard. In the early 1960's the floor and pews were replaced. The church now has a narthex, and the organ and choir stalls are at the west end. The spiral staircase is narrow and leads up the tower first to a room behind the organ pipes.
